page.title: 07The Shoreline Landscape
page.content: The shoreline in our area stretches from North Killingholme Haven to the outskirts of Immingham Docks. Along the shoreline runs the{Humber Wall a {defence against the sea}made up of{ {large boulders covered with bitumen {and an access road on the top.}On the seaward side of the wall the land falls towards the estuary past the High Water Mark. A survey along the Humber Wall shows the following pattern:near the northern edge of the area is a zone of{raised marsh} extending southwards, this changes to an area of{wet marsh}often covered by the sea, the final stretch towards Immingham docks is one of{mud and {shingle beach}with large boulders up to the foot of the wall. Different types of debris litter the shore including rubbish from passing ships.
